abstract.p: Canada's central bank raises its overnight lending rate, known as the bank rate, by half percentage point, to 6 percent, matching the half-point increase in the federal funds rate in the United States; prime lending rates at Canadian chartered banks will also go up half point to 7.5 percent (S)

block.p: Canada's central bank raised its overnight lending rate, known as the bank rate, by half a percentage point, to 6 percent, matching the half-point increase in the federal funds rate in the United States. Prime lending rates at Canadian chartered banks will also go up by half a point, to 7.5 percent. Although Canada's core inflation rate -- excluding energy and food -- is only 1.5 percent, the Bank of Canada warned that strong demand, especially from the United States, could put ''excessive pressure on the economy's capacity limits, and thus on inflation.''
